ovdesc.p: This manual ‘H’ type table allows the automatic process dispatch of the processed inward files given the noticed error level. It consists in a numeric key specified below.
Level ‘0’: No remarks
or Unable to download the file
Unable to load file & (Access read is not granted for the inward library)
Unable to copy file & (Access write is not granted for the FT.IN.TAPE library)
or Light warning
Extract impossible for & (SEPA.INWARD record is missing for a pending message extract)
Similar message already processed on & (same calc key but different Group Header)
Empty message
Resumption after a processing failure
Level ‘1’: Structural remarks unable to jeopardize the message processing
Message &1 : & lines instead of &
Message &1 : Amount = & instead of &
Message &1 : &4
Level ‘2’: Serious problem preventing the message from being processed
Instructed is & and not & (the bank is not the instructed agent)
Message already processed on & (same calc keys and same Group Header)
Where & is a specific variable (date, BIC code, number or amount).
&1 is the message sequence in the received file.
&2 is the Transaction Information sequence in the message.
&3 is the returned ETEXT message from a field formatting routine (FIELD.TYPE).
&4 is the explicit message associated to a found error:
o No follow up available for &5
o Unauthorized follow up for &5
o Initial operation incompatible &5
&5 is the operation code of the associated SEPA message.

desc.p: This Field contains the PROCESS.LEVEL log field Enrichment.
This Field specifies the Destination for the processed file.

This field holds the Routine executed prior to the final move of the file. The return of common variable ETEXT posts a message in the log file and the destination library may be changed via the input/output common variable COMI.
This Field specifies the Error level (0, 1 or 2).
Value must be 1 type should be Numeric
This field contains the Value ‘Y’ which specifies that the 'The file is restored in its inward library' and Also the Value 'NO'
